title: Leavebuster from Remake after entering game
body:
I am not sure if this was intentional, but I recently got a leavebuster warning going into my 10th game for flex queue. i was having trouble connecting to the loading screen so i continually relogged until it finally worked. Upon entering the game my team called for a remake vote (I was ingame and then voting box popped up with 5 value) and it passed isntantly after two people hit yes (registered saying 2 allies voted yes).

I'm just very frustrated that I got hit with a leave due to a connection issue and sat there helpless as I literally started walking to lane and watched it all happen. Is this an intentional build for the system? I 'm just concerned about it possibly happening again.

Only "proof" I have is I guess making it to the [end screen](http://imgur.com/a/yn2FT). Guess it might show me connecting in the replay as well.

replies.body:
Yes, this is intentional. The system treats all disconnections equally because regardless of intent, your absence from the match leaves your team one player down and at a disadvantage. You can find more about the Leaverbuster system in our [**Leaverbuster FAQ**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ).

Most connection issues are caused by incompatible network settings, so I recommend working through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to prevent this from happening again.

Let me know if you have any questions.
